title: Ensure Skip button is always visible for Event 1 and Event 4 gameplay

requirements.summary: Guarantee a visible English "Skip" button in Event 1 (default) and Event 4 (promises-100) gameplay that advances to the next level, while remaining visible but disabled on level 100.
acceptanceCriteria: Starting Event 1 opens gameplay and displays a visible "Skip" button.
Starting Event 4 opens gameplay and displays a visible "Skip" button.
Clicking "Skip" in either event advances the game to the next level (i.e., the displayed level number increments and the next level is playable).
On level 100, the "Skip" button remains visible but is disabled (cannot be clicked).
All user-facing text for the button is in English ("Skip").

file_operations.description: Make the gameplay header (including the "Skip" button) reliably visible and clickable above all level content for both game variants (gameId "default" and "promises-100"), e.g., by ensuring consistent stacking context/z-index and layout behavior. Keep the button label exactly "Skip" and keep it visible while disabled on the final level (100). Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui.

Add a defensive guard in the skip flow so that attempting to skip on the final level does not advance progress (even if triggered programmatically), while keeping existing Events hub -> gameplay single-screen flow and existing progress persistence behavior intact.
